member.name: T:Amazon.RDSDataService.Model.BatchExecuteStatementRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the BatchExecuteStatement operation. Runs a batch SQL statement over an array of data.
You can run bulk update and insert operations for multiple records using a DML statement with different parameter sets. Bulk operations can provide a significant performance improvement over individual insert and update operations.
If a call isn't part of a transaction because it doesn't include the transactionID parameter, changes that result from the call are committed automatically.

member.name: P:Amazon.RDSDataService.Model.BatchExecuteStatementRequest.Database
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Database.
The name of the database.

member.name: P:Amazon.RDSDataService.Model.BatchExecuteStatementRequest.ParameterSets
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ParameterSets.
The parameter set for the batch operation.
The SQL statement is executed as many times as the number of parameter sets provided. To execute a SQL statement with no parameters, use one of the following options:
Specify one or more empty parameter sets.
Use the ExecuteStatement operation instead of the BatchExecuteStatement operation.
Array parameters are not supported.

member.name: P:Amazon.RDSDataService.Model.BatchExecuteStatementRequest.ResourceArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Aurora Serverless DB cluster.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Schema.
The name of the database schema.

member.name: P:Amazon.RDSDataService.Model.BatchExecuteStatementRequest.SecretArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretArn.
The name or ARN of the secret that enables access to the DB cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.RDSDataService.Model.BatchExecuteStatementRequest.Sql
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Sql.
The SQL statement to run.

member.name: P:Amazon.RDSDataService.Model.BatchExecuteStatementRequest.TransactionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TransactionId.
The identifier of a transaction that was started by using the BeginTransaction operation. Specify the transaction ID of the transaction that you want to include the SQL statement in.
If the SQL statement is not part of a transaction, don't set this parameter.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UpdateResults.
The execution results of each batch entry.

member.name: T:Amazon.RDSDataService.Model.BeginTransactionRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the BeginTransaction operation. Starts a SQL transaction.

A transaction can run for a maximum of 24 hours. A transaction is terminated and rolled back automatically after 24 hours.

A transaction times out if no calls use its transaction ID in three minutes. If a transaction times out before it's committed, it's rolled back automatically.

DDL statements inside a transaction cause an implicit commit. We recommend that you run each DDL statement in a separate ExecuteStatement call with continueAfterTimeout enabled.

member.name: T:Amazon.RDSDataService.Model.ExecuteStatementRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ExecuteStatement operation. Runs a SQL statement against a database.
If a call isn't part of a transaction because it doesn't include the transactionID parameter, changes that result from the call are committed automatically.
The response size limit is 1 MB. If the call returns more than 1 MB of response data, the call is terminated.

member.name: P:Amazon.RDSDataService.Model.ExecuteStatementRequest.ContinueAfterTimeout
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContinueAfterTimeout.
A value that indicates whether to continue running the statement after the call times out. By default, the statement stops running when the call times out.
For DDL statements, we recommend continuing to run the statement after the call times out. When a DDL statement terminates before it is finished running, it can result in errors and possibly corrupted data structures.

member.name: P:Amazon.RDSDataService.Model.ResultSetOptions.DecimalReturnType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DecimalReturnType.
A value that indicates how a field of DECIMAL type is represented in the response. The value of STRING, the default, specifies that it is converted to a String value. The value of DOUBLE_OR_LONG specifies that it is converted to a Long value if its scale is 0, or to a Double value otherwise.
Conversion to Double or Long can result in roundoff errors due to precision loss. We recommend converting to String, especially when working with currency values.

member.name: P:Amazon.RDSDataService.Model.SqlParameter.Name
member.summary:

The name of the parameter.

member.name: P:Amazon.RDSDataService.Model.SqlParameter.TypeHint
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TypeHint.
A hint that specifies the correct object type for data type mapping. Possible values are as follows:
DATE - The corresponding String parameter value is sent as an object of DATE type to the database. The accepted format is YYYY-MM-DD.
DECIMAL - The corresponding String parameter value is sent as an object of DECIMAL type to the database.
JSON - The corresponding String parameter value is sent as an object of JSON type to the database.
TIME - The corresponding String parameter value is sent as an object of TIME type to the database. The accepted format is HH:MM:SS[.FFF].
TIMESTAMP - The corresponding String parameter value is sent as an object of TIMESTAMP type to the database. The accepted format is YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS[.FFF].
UUID - The corresponding String parameter value is sent as an object of UUID type to the database.

member.name: T:Amazon.RDSDataService.AmazonRDSDataServiceClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing RDSDataService
Amazon RDS Data Service
Amazon RDS provides an HTTP endpoint to run SQL statements on an Amazon Aurora Serverless DB cluster. To run these statements, you work with the Data Service API.
For more information about the Data Service API, see Using the Data API for Aurora Serverless in the Amazon Aurora User Guide.

member.name: M:Amazon.RDSDataService.AmazonRDSDataServiceClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonRDSDataServiceClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.RDSDataService.AmazonRDSDataServiceClient.BatchExecuteStatement(Amazon.RDSDataService.Model.BatchExecuteStatementRequest)
member.summary:
Runs a batch SQL statement over an array of data.
You can run bulk update and insert operations for multiple records using a DML statement with different parameter sets. Bulk operations can provide a significant performance improvement over individual insert and update operations.
If a call isn't part of a transaction because it doesn't include the transactionID parameter, changes that result from the call are committed automatically.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the BatchExecuteStatement service method.
member.returns: The response from the BatchExecuteStatement service method, as returned by RDSDataService.
member.exception: There is an error in the call or in a SQL statement.
There are insufficient privileges to make the call.
An internal error occurred.
The service specified by the resourceArn parameter is not available.
The execution of the SQL statement timed out.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for BatchExecuteStatement Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.RDSDataService.AmazonRDSDataServiceClient.BatchExecuteStatementAsync(Amazon.RDSDataService.Model.BatchExecuteStatementRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
Runs a batch SQL statement over an array of data.
You can run bulk update and insert operations for multiple records using a DML statement with different parameter sets. Bulk operations can provide a significant performance improvement over individual insert and update operations.
If a call isn't part of a transaction because it doesn't include the transactionID parameter, changes that result from the call are committed automatically.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the BatchExecuteStatement service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the BatchExecuteStatement service method, as returned by RDSDataService.
member.exception: There is an error in the call or in a SQL statement.
There are insufficient privileges to make the call.
An internal error occurred.
The service specified by the resourceArn parameter is not available.
The execution of the SQL statement timed out.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for BatchExecuteStatement Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.RDSDataService.AmazonRDSDataServiceClient.BeginTransaction(Amazon.RDSDataService.Model.BeginTransactionRequest)
member.summary:
Starts a SQL transaction.

A transaction can run for a maximum of 24 hours. A transaction is terminated and rolled back automatically after 24 hours.

A transaction times out if no calls use its transaction ID in three minutes. If a transaction times out before it's committed, it's rolled back automatically.

DDL statements inside a transaction cause an implicit commit. We recommend that you run each DDL statement in a separate ExecuteStatement call with continueAfterTimeout enabled.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the BeginTransaction service method.
member.returns: The response from the BeginTransaction service method, as returned by RDSDataService.
member.exception: There is an error in the call or in a SQL statement.
There are insufficient privileges to make the call.
An internal error occurred.
The service specified by the resourceArn parameter is not available.
The execution of the SQL statement timed out.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for BeginTransaction Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.RDSDataService.AmazonRDSDataServiceClient.ExecuteStatement(Amazon.RDSDataService.Model.ExecuteStatementRequest)
member.summary:
Runs a SQL statement against a database.
If a call isn't part of a transaction because it doesn't include the transactionID parameter, changes that result from the call are committed automatically.
The response size limit is 1 MB. If the call returns more than 1 MB of response data, the call is terminated.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ExecuteStatement service method.
member.returns: The response from the ExecuteStatement service method, as returned by RDSDataService.
member.exception: There is an error in the call or in a SQL statement.

This operation is deprecated. Use the BatchExecuteStatement or ExecuteStatement operation.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ExecuteSql service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the ExecuteSql service method, as returned by RDSDataService.
member.exception: There is an error in the call or in a SQL statement.
There are insufficient privileges to make the call.
An internal error occurred.
The service specified by the resourceArn parameter is not available.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for ExecuteSql Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.RDSDataService.IAmazonRDSDataService.ExecuteStatement(Amazon.RDSDataService.Model.ExecuteStatementRequest)
member.summary:
Runs a SQL statement against a database.
If a call isn't part of a transaction because it doesn't include the transactionID parameter, changes that result from the call are committed automatically.
The response size limit is 1 MB. If the call returns more than 1 MB of response data, the call is terminated.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ExecuteStatement service method.
member.returns: The response from the ExecuteStatement service method, as returned by RDSDataService.
member.exception: There is an error in the call or in a SQL statement.
There are insufficient privileges to make the call.
An internal error occurred.
The service specified by the resourceArn parameter is not available.
The execution of the SQL statement timed out.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for ExecuteStatement Operation

member.name: M:Amazon.RDSDataService.IAmazonRDSDataService.RollbackTransaction(Amazon.RDSDataService.Model.RollbackTransactionRequest)
member.summary: Performs a rollback of a transaction. Rolling back a transaction cancels its changes.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the RollbackTransaction service method.
member.returns: The response from the RollbackTransaction service method, as returned by RDSDataService.
member.exception: There is an error in the call or in a SQL statement.
There are insufficient privileges to make the call.
An internal error occurred.
The resourceArn, secretArn, or transactionId value can't be found.
The service specified by the resourceArn parameter is not available.
The execution of the SQL statement timed out.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for RollbackTransaction Operation
